Add a longnostic to a dataframe

add_longnostic.Rd

Match a longnostic to the id of a dataframe. This saves you creating a longnostic and then joining it back to a dataframe

add_l_max(data, id, var)

add_l_diff(data, id, var, lag = 1)

add_l_mean(data, id, var)

add_l_median(data, id, var)

add_l_min(data, id, var)

add_l_n_obs(data, id)

add_l_q1(data, id, var)

add_l_q3(data, id, var)

add_l_sd(data, id, var)

add_l_slope(data, id, formula)

Arguments

data

data.frame to explore
id

vector of ids to define which values belong to which individual
var

vector of values for individuals, needs to match the id vector
lag

the lag to use, default to 1 (used with l_diff)
formula

character, a formula representing the slope of interest (used in l_slope)

Examples

add_l_max(data = wages, id = id, var = lnw)
#> # A tibble: 6,402 x 10
#>       id l_max   lnw exper   ged postexp black hispanic   hgc uerate
#>    <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <int>   <dbl> <int>    <int> <int>  <dbl>
#>  1    31  2.13  1.49 0.015     1   0.015     0        1     8   3.21
#>  2    31  2.13  1.43 0.715     1   0.715     0        1     8   3.21
#>  3    31  2.13  1.47 1.73      1   1.73      0        1     8   3.21

#>  8    31  2.13  2.13 6.98      1   6.98      0        1     8   4.8

#> 10    36  2.93  1.80 0.983     1   0.983     0        0     9   7.4 
#> # … with 6,392 more rows
